content: I have been using this trick for quite some time for different websites including bitcointalk and ChatGPT also, it kinda converts any website into a mobile app that sits on your home page like any other app. Technically speaking it's not like a native app but still it does pretty well. It works on iOS only since it uses Apple Shortcut Application to do so, which itself is a very powerful app if you are an Apple user. Anyway, let's start and give it a try.Prerequisite  - Shortcuts App:Before starting just make sure you have Shortcuts app installed.If not you can search it on the App Store or just click below image Step 1 - Image for app icon: Download the image below and save it to photos, we will use it for our App Icon.You can use any other image too but I like this one since it's kinda official logon for Bitcointalk.https://talkimg.com/images/2023/09/06/mPhP2.png Step 2 - Download Shortcut:Download this shortcut from iCloud https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/97dcbfe75e074ad19077f20304342d74Above link should automatically open the Shortcuts app. If not then copy paste below link in Safari browser and then click Open in Shortcuts Once open you will see below screen, click Add Shortcut   Step 3 - Run shortcut:Once added you will see a new shortcut added on the Shortcuts app.Click the this shortcut "Make app from URL and follow the promptsa. Enter the app name preferably "Bitcointalk" b. Enter the URL (this URL will be used as a homepage for our app)    I like to set it Show new replies to your posts. as my home page but you can use any bitcointalk link    https://bitcointalk.org/ or https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=unreadrepliesc. Select the image you saved in Step 2 for the App Icon,  Click Done    It will open a safari browser and show a popupd. Click allow to download configuration profile   Step 4 - Install profile:Now go to iPhone Settings and on the home page you should see Profile Downloaded (If not available on the home page then Settings -> General -> VPN & Device Management)a. Click on Bitcointalkb. Click Install   Congratulation just open the app Login for the first time and enjoy your Bitcointalk as a Mobile AppPro and cons: - You don't to need to enter URL every time to you open bitcointalk - It's running in a full screen, no browser URL or extra buttons - To Remove the app go to Settings -> General -> VPN & Device Management ->Bitcointalk  and click Remove Profile - There's no hidden scripts or any thing, it's just running Bitcointalk as a fullscreen Media Clip in a Safari Browser - No back/forward buttons? You don't need, just swap your screen left or right to move back or forward

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: The biggest problems with posting on Bitcointalk from a mobile app is dealing with quotes and multiquotes. No mobile app can help me to select parts of someone's post, copy only that, delete the rest, quickly add code for hyperlinks, images, etc. The experience doesn't improve, but gets worse on the phone. Imagine trying to create a table on your phone. This is OK for general forum browsing and reading. Making the occasional post here and there, sure. But a phone is never going to become a substitute for a desktop device with a mouse.

comments.body: Quote from: shahzadafzal on January 15, 2023, 06:07:20 PMIt works on iOS only since it uses Apple Shortcut Application to do so, which itself is a very powerful app if you are an Apple user. Thanks For providing this 5 minute trick to make Apps from Website. I checked this in my Android Phone but it only available for Apple.But don't worry I have find the website where you can easily make Android application from website with some basic tool like color,icon tools. It will take only 3-5 minute to createThings Required:1: Android Phones ( not checked on apple)2: Gmail3: Bitcointalk Logo ( Optional)4: Disable Google Protect if on (because it will install the App outside from Playstore)Now Let's Start:1ST Step: Download the Logo given By Shahzad Afzal at the start:Quote https://i.imgur.com/0fPaJ29.png 2nd Step:Now Goto Website in any browser but I will recommend Google Chrome. I checked in chrome and it worked fine for mehttps://appsgeyser.com/create-website-app/ 3rd Step: Write Website Name in Blank Field like In below image I used " Bitcointalk.Org " and click on GET CONTENT.Note: after clicking on Get content , Website will create Matching Template for your Website but you can choose by own also or you can forward without any template. Choose any Template. I did not change here anything and I kept it as default.You can Change color and  App Layout4th Step: Click On previous To watch out Look of App. If everything is Ok Click on Nextnote: It will ask for Ads. Just select option " No monetization"5th Step: Write Name of App and Select Custom Icon and Upload icon which we already downloaded and Then Click On Create:6th Step: Now it will will ask for Sign up. Just sign up through Email and It will ask for Subscription but Don't worry it's freeClick On Yellow Color Arrow in the top barCongratulations your App has been Created. Now last step to Download App. Then click on link provided. You can share this link with any one to download and you will see how much time this App has been downloaded.Final Look: Back and Other Menu Button working well

Same goes to all the external links it will open like a popup and you just click done/close the popup and go back to your bitcointalk. Yes it’s not a 100% mobile app. We all know this but I’m talking about my personal experience and I really like using this trick when I’m on mobile and gives a much better experience than a normal browser window.Quote from: libert19 on January 22, 2023, 07:10:09 AMAs long you have visited the page prior, you can move back/forward similarly. Well technically speaking in this case your backs/ forwards are unlimited and it will never go out of bitcointalk.
